p.i: The House met at half-past Two o'clock

speech.p: [MR. SPEAKER in the Chair]

It may be for the convenience of the House if I indicate that after calling upon all hon. Members in the Chamber to take the Oath or to affirm I shall suspend the sitting until 3.30 pm. I shall again be in the Chair at 4.30 pm. That will be the last occasion today. Tomorrow, after the state opening of Parliament, I shall resume the Chair at 2.15 pm and hope to complete the swearing in of hon. Members before the business of the House begins.

p.i: The following Members took and subscribed the Oath, or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by Law:

Resolved, That this House do now adjourn till tomorrow—[Mr. Douglas Hogg.]

p.i: Adjourned accordingly at eight minutes to Five o'clock.
